Instance.description: A one state festival situation that has the ability to spawn objects into the festival goer's inventory (and not leak them).

TunableList.name: objects_to_create
TunableList.description: A tested list of objects to create into the Sims inventory when they are added to the situation.

TunableTuple.description: An entry in this tested list.

TunableTuple.name: item
TunableTuple.description: Data used for the creation of these objects.

TunableTuple.name: clone_object
TunableTuple.description: Specify an object to be cloned.

TunableVariant.name: definition_override
TunableVariant.description: Override to specify a different definition than that of the object being cloned.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The definition of the object that is created.

TunableVariant.name: source_object
TunableVariant.description: Where the object to be cloned can be found.

TunableTuple.name: is_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is a participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Used to clone a participant object.

TunableTuple.name: slotted_to_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is one slotted on a participant.

TunableTuple.name: slotted_to_participant
TunableTuple.description: Used to clone an object slotted to a participant.

TunableEnum.name: parent_object_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant object which will contain the specified slot where the object to be cloned is slotted.

Tunable.name: parent_slot_type
Tunable.description: A particular slot type where the cloned object can be found. The first slot of this type found on the source_object will be used.

TunableTuple.name: create_photo_object
TunableTuple.description: Create a photo object based on the participant target.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Used to create photo of a participant object.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: Specify an object definition.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object that is created.

TunableTuple.name: definition_tested
TunableTuple.description: Specify an object definition based on tests.

TunableList.name: definitions
TunableList.description: A list of potential object definitions to use.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object to be created.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: The weight of this definition relative to other definitions in this list.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: fallback_definition
Tunable.description: Should no test pass, use this definition.

TunableTuple.name: from_fishing_data
TunableTuple.description: Create a fish object from the tuned participant fishing data.

TunableVariant.name: source
TunableVariant.description: Source on which we will get the fishing data information

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The fishing data is from tuned participant.

TunableVariant.name: luck_config
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, Luck will influence which fish is selected.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that users provide to Luck Service in order to appropriately use Luck.

TunableList.name: loot_actions
TunableList.description: Loots that are applied when luck has an impact in this context. If you want a loot to apply when luck has an impact even outside of this context, use the luck module tuning instead.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose luck we want to check when calculating luck options.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant on which we will get the fishing data information

TunableTuple.name: reference
TunableTuple.description: The fishing data is from tuned reference.

Tunable.name: fishing_data
Tunable.description: Fishing data reference.

TunableVariant.name: luck_config
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, Luck will influence which fish is selected.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that users provide to Luck Service in order to appropriately use Luck.

TunableList.name: loot_actions
TunableList.description: Loots that are applied when luck has an impact in this context. If you want a loot to apply when luck has an impact even outside of this context, use the luck module tuning instead.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose luck we want to check when calculating luck options.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant to create an instance of.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant object we would like to create an instance of.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_info
TunableTuple.description: Create an object using info stored on the source participant.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_info_participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim participant of this interaction which contains the stored object info that is used to create this object.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object being stored. This will be used to retrieve the stored object from the Stored Object Info Component of the target.

TunableTuple.name: random_by_tags
TunableTuple.description: Specify a tag which will randomly choose an object that has been marked with that tag and create it.

TunableEnum.description: Define tags to try and create the object. Picks randomly from objects with these tags.

TunableTuple.name: random_recipe

TunableTuple.description: The weighted recipe.

TunableTuple.name: recipe
TunableTuple.description: Specify a recipe. The final product's definition is used as a definition.

Tunable.name: recipe
Tunable.description: The recipe to use to create the object.

Tunable.name: show_crafted_by_text
Tunable.description: Show crafted by text on the tooltip of item created by this recipe. Will not be visible if crafter is not a sim.

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

TunableTuple.description: Specify a weighted list of recipes tags that can be available for recipe creation.

TunableList.description: A list of weighted list of recipe tags that can be available for recipe creation.

TunableTuple.description: The weighted recipe tag.

TunableTuple.name: recipe_tag
TunableTuple.description: Specify a recipe tag. The final product's definition is used as a definition.

TunableEnum.name: recipe_tag
TunableEnum.description: The recipe tag to use to create the object.

Tunable.name: show_crafted_by_text
Tunable.description: Show crafted by text on the tooltip of item created by this recipe. Will not be visible if crafter is not a sim.

Tunable.name: show_crafted_by_text
Tunable.description: Show crafted by text on the tooltip of item created by this recipe. Will not be visible if crafter is not a sim.

TunableTuple.name: recipe_by_tag
TunableTuple.description: Specify a recipe tag. The final product's definition is used as a definition.

TunableEnum.name: recipe_tag
TunableEnum.description: The recipe tag to use to create the object.

Tunable.name: show_crafted_by_text
Tunable.description: Show crafted by text on the tooltip of item created by this recipe. Will not be visible if crafter is not a sim.

TunableTuple.name: serving
TunableTuple.description: Create an object that is a serving of the specified crafted object. This loot can be used to create an object outside of the GrabServingInteraction flow, which requires the Sim to go into carry posture. Use cases: - For cases where we want to get more than one serving at a time in a single interaction, we don't want to run the grab serving more than once. e.g. cauldron bottle up all servings of a potion. - For cases where we don't even want to run a carry at all. e.g. cauldron drink from cauldron, we want to drink directly from the cauldron (no carry), but create a hidden object we can run a custom consume on.

TunableList.name: transferred_states
TunableList.description: A list of states to be copied over to the created object.

TunableList.name: transferred_stats
TunableList.description: A list of stats to be copied over to the created object.

Tunable.name: use_base_recipe_on_setup
Tunable.description: If enabled, the created serving will use the Base Object when being set up. Otherwise, the recipe tuning will be used. In general, this should stay checked. Unchecking this is useful for objects like the Pit BBQ where a group serving is being pulled from another group serving. The 'Call to Meal' interactions will be forwarded correctly.

Tunable.name: use_linked_recipe_mapping
Tunable.description: If enabled, when creating the recipe, instead of using the base recipe it will look into the recipe linked recipe tuning and find what recipes it can generate. This is used to support multiple recipes generated from the same multiserve. i.e. Ice cream carton can generate bowls, milkshakes and cones.

TunableTuple.name: urnstone_definition_tested
TunableTuple.description: Specify an urnstone definition based on a series of tests, first checking for an urnstone specified in will and then using fallback_definition is none is found.

TunableList.name: definitions
TunableList.description: A list of potential object definitions to use.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object to be created.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: The weight of this definition relative to other definitions in this list.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers

Tunable.name: multiplier

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: fallback_definition
Tunable.description: Should no test pass, use this definition.

TunableList.name: initial_states
TunableList.description: A list of states to apply on the object when they are first created.

Tunable.name: stop_processing
Tunable.description: If checked, no other element from this list is considered if this element passes its associated test.

TdescFragTag.name: test
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs
